PP.content: an inscription, Delphikon gramma [Phaedrus (229d)], anything but oracle, prescribes silent cipher, signifies, orders autoscopy, autognosis [re: Socrates’ send-off of myths]
PP.linkedContent: an inscription, Delphikon gramma [Phaedrus (229d)], anything but oracle, prescribes silent cipher, signifies, orders autoscopy, autognosis [re: Socrates’ send-off of myths]

F.content: topography “twice cleft”; dividing line runs through intrasymbolism of Self and Unconscious (the twice divided, or double division, is what creates an undecipherable symbol)
F.linkedContent: topography “twice cleft”; dividing line runs through intrasymbolism of Self and Unconscious (the twice divided, or double division, is what creates an undecipherable symbol)

F.content: language inhabits crypt as “mots enterrés vifs,” words relieved of communicative function, marking, in a way, that le désir a été d’une certaine manière satisfait, que la jouissance a eu lieu
F.linkedContent: language inhabits crypt as “mots enterrés vifs,” words relieved of communicative function, marking, in a way, that le désir a été d’une certaine manière satisfait, que la jouissance a eu lieu

F.content: Wolf Man’s crypt not melancholic crypt, doesn’t shelter his own object, but illegitimate object of another [his sister] > if cemetery guard lacks ownership of the tombs, at least he’s entitled to position, Wolf Man is in position of guard as proxy [pp. 199-20n position as guard has been mortgaged, Derrida haunted by this word, this “death pledge”]
F.linkedContent: Wolf Man’s crypt not melancholic crypt, doesn’t shelter his own object, but illegitimate object of another [his sister] > if cemetery guard lacks ownership of the tombs, at least he’s entitled to position, Wolf Man is in position of guard as proxy [pp. 199-20n position as guard has been mortgaged, Derrida haunted by this word, this “death pledge”]

F.content: encrypted, coded text written on crypt is not written on a pre-existing partition, the partition is the material of the text > crypter, c’est chiffrer ——one can never manipulate a secret code alone
F.linkedContent: encrypted, coded text written on crypt is not written on a pre-existing partition, the partition is the material of the text > crypter, c’est chiffrer ——one can never manipulate a secret code alone

F.content: the reason a code is indispensable to a crypt is because the ghosts floating around it exchange signs
F.linkedContent: the reason a code is indispensable to a crypt is because the ghosts floating around it exchange signs

F.content: Abraham and Torok decipher a story that was its own ciphering, tell the story of a story, from one word, one safe (for), to another
F.linkedContent: Abraham and Torok decipher a story that was its own ciphering, tell the story of a story, from one word, one safe (for), to another

F.content: crypt of language: contract w/ dead, dead must pledge to occupy place as dead, must engage dying self alive
F.linkedContent: crypt of language: contract w/ dead, dead must pledge to occupy place as dead, must engage dying self alive

F.content: pledge as pocket [Genet’s matchbox] > double desire, thanato-poetic pleasure (plaisir) can catch fire
F.linkedContent: pledge as pocket [Genet’s matchbox] > double desire, thanato-poetic pleasure (plaisir) can catch fire

F.content: pocket near pudenda, extra flap of cloth, where most precious thing is kept: money, title, share in stock market [crypt as wallet]
F.linkedContent: pocket near pudenda, extra flap of cloth, where most precious thing is kept: money, title, share in stock market [crypt as wallet]

F.content: cryptophore, à manger le morceau (le mors) sans pouvoir le digérer, must constantly betray cipher that seals and conceals it > Blanchot’s L’arrêt de mort, truly cryptic story
F.linkedContent: cryptophore, à manger le morceau (le mors) sans pouvoir le digérer, must constantly betray cipher that seals and conceals it > Blanchot’s L’arrêt de mort, truly cryptic story

F.content: cryptonomy is not purely verbal, but perception, like all mute pictures, falls under laws of cipher
F.linkedContent: cryptonomy is not purely verbal, but perception, like all mute pictures, falls under laws of cipher

F.content: “Cause” is designified in the crypt of anasemia, a trace w/ no present in its wake > Thing does not speak, is not a thing, its testamentary structure organizes funeral pomp of crypt
F.linkedContent: “Cause” is designified in the crypt of anasemia, a trace w/ no present in its wake > Thing does not speak, is not a thing, its testamentary structure organizes funeral pomp of crypt

F.content: [re: Wolf Man’s cryptonomic translations] phonetic contaminations, nonsemantic associations, neither rhetorical figures nor metonymic displacements > but angular: contact (semantic or formal) w/ surface of its allosemes acc. most economical line/surface
F.linkedContent: [re: Wolf Man’s cryptonomic translations] phonetic contaminations, nonsemantic associations, neither rhetorical figures nor metonymic displacements > but angular: contact (semantic or formal) w/ surface of its allosemes acc. most economical line/surface

F.content: cryptonymic translations, art of chicanery, judicial pettifogging, hidden doors, detours > seduces, discourages, fascinates, fatigues
F.linkedContent: cryptonymic translations, art of chicanery, judicial pettifogging, hidden doors, detours > seduces, discourages, fascinates, fatigues

F.content: cryptonomy follows contacts, straight lines or surfaces in most economical way, this makes cryptonomic the once inflexible logic of castration
F.linkedContent: cryptonomy follows contacts, straight lines or surfaces in most economical way, this makes cryptonomic the once inflexible logic of castration

F.content: “cryptonyms of repressed pleasure words” [re: Grateloup, tieret, rub, scar, Thing]
F.linkedContent: “cryptonyms of repressed pleasure words” [re: Grateloup, tieret, rub, scar, Thing]

F.content: cryptonomy is said first of [his, Wolf Man’s] proper name (what it kept secret): monument of a catastrophe
F.linkedContent: cryptonomy is said first of [his, Wolf Man’s] proper name (what it kept secret): monument of a catastrophe

F.content: et c’est dans la mesure où la crypte fermait mal qu’une chance restait encore: le preuve > but the proof came for Wolf Man too late
F.linkedContent: et c’est dans la mesure où la crypte fermait mal qu’une chance restait encore: le preuve > but the proof came for Wolf Man too late

F.content: could Wolf Man read what is written here on his crypt?
F.linkedContent: could Wolf Man read what is written here on his crypt?

F.content: cryptonomy: crack (la ligne de brisure) of a symbol, upright column of name (colonne érigée d’un nom), blank voice of a scruple [see p. xiii], always extends beyond the self
F.linkedContent: cryptonomy: crack (la ligne de brisure) of a symbol, upright column of name (colonne érigée d’un nom), blank voice of a scruple [see p. xiii], always extends beyond the self

SP.content: Derrida exposes cryptic structure of writing by “confessing” to it “directly,” re: Nietzsche’s forgetting the umbrella; one could never heed the cryptic warning, what if the “limits of will to mean” are exactly what Nietzsche meant w/ this phrase, an intentional graft
SP.linkedContent: Derrida exposes cryptic structure of writing by “confessing” to it “directly,” re: Nietzsche’s forgetting the umbrella; one could never heed the cryptic warning, what if the “limits of will to mean” are exactly what Nietzsche meant w/ this phrase, an intentional graft

REST.content: obviously secret: cipher remains secret because not concealed > encrypted in the ether of obviousness & truth [re: correspondence btwn Heidegger/Shapiro] [cf. p. 283 “invisible ether of this trivial self-evidence”: the shoes in the work are out of work because they are painted]
REST.linkedContent: obviously secret: cipher remains secret because not concealed > encrypted in the ether of obviousness & truth [re: correspondence btwn Heidegger/Shapiro] [cf. p. 283 “invisible ether of this trivial self-evidence”: the shoes in the work are out of work because they are painted]

REST.content: would have to render secret already legible, like a remainder of a useless cipher
REST.linkedContent: would have to render secret already legible, like a remainder of a useless cipher

EL.content: apocalyptô: 1) decrypting what is hidden, revelation/unveiling 2) end time, last judgment 3) catastrophe, cataclysm
EL.linkedContent: apocalyptô: 1) decrypting what is hidden, revelation/unveiling 2) end time, last judgment 3) catastrophe, cataclysm

EL.content: Scholem describes a move from national, exoteric [straightforward] Messianism to cryptographic, esoteric, elitist, apocalypticism accentuated by Jews losing their nation: the cryptic veil becomes “its very phenomenality, its state and its efficacy”
EL.linkedContent: Scholem describes a move from national, exoteric [straightforward] Messianism to cryptographic, esoteric, elitist, apocalypticism accentuated by Jews losing their nation: the cryptic veil becomes “its very phenomenality, its state and its efficacy”

SPEC.content: Freud’s “to let develop” [re: Aristophanes’ speech] mortgages irresponsibility, no engagement, epokhē of judgment, speaks from no-place [Lacan takes Beyond… too seriously?]
SPEC.linkedContent: Freud’s “to let develop” [re: Aristophanes’ speech] mortgages irresponsibility, no engagement, epokhē of judgment, speaks from no-place [Lacan takes Beyond… too seriously?]
